description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8c20t","text":"In this restriction digest, you'll use an enzyme that cuts DNA to cut your miniprepped plasmid. This can give you some evidence as to whether your plasmid is what you expected or not.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6h3fb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5s3hq","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"463p4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"n7kc","text":"You'll also use Benchling to predict the result of your digest -- that way, you can compare your prediction to your actual result.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":29,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"06330640198711ED8713139E7264A843","height":516,"id":280720,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"digest.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iueubvh6p.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iuesbvh6p.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iuetbvh6p.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iuerbvh6p.webp","width":472}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e085h","text":"For each miniprep, compute the volume that contains   of DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":52,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ruef","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"6B05E060198711ED8713139E7264A843","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":4}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9457d","text":"In the PCR tube, mix:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8grfd","text":"The volume of DNA you computed in step 1, up to a maximum of  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":42,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":61,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"31jqq","text":"  of CutSmart enzyme buffer","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e5i96","text":"  of PvuII enzyme","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cfbrq","text":"Enough nuclease-free water for a total volume of  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":49,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e22c0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"enbir","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"13jeo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"814F4A50198711ED8713139E7264A843","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"83570130198711ED8713139E7264A843","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"855198B0198711ED8713139E7264A843","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"8805BC30198711ED8713139E7264A843","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5u82n","text":"Mix by flicking the tube gently, then spin down briefly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cptmo","text":"After your ditest is complete, proceed to analyze your restriction digest using gel electrophoresis. There's no need to keep any around for future use.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9cbse","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"AEAF8050198711ED8713139E7264A843","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cmp4m","text":"While your digest is running, you can use Benchling to simulate your digest. Begin by opening the \"Cas9 Plasmid\" document (or whichever document your instructor indicates). Then, click the \"scissors\" icon on the right to open the restriction digest panel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"37msi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2dmps","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ebsm1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6FF865B0198811ED8713139E7264A843","height":710,"id":280726,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"benchling40.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iue2bvh6p.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iueybvh6p.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iuezbvh6p.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iuexbvh6p.webp","width":448}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8pk9b","text":"Pull down the \"Enzyme Lists\" drop-down and choose \"NEB\". In the \"Find Enzyme\" box, type \"PvuII\" (that's the letters \"Pvu\" and two upper-case i's). The enzyme list should just show \"PvuII\" -- click it. The new tab that opens tells you the sizes of the DNA fragments were you to digest this plasmid with those enzyme(s).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dkkeg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7n782","text":"  \n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"84ovm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"DDE7B530198811ED8713139E7264A843","height":209,"id":280734,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"benchling43.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iufabvh6p.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iue8bvh6p.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iue9bvh6p.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iue7bvh6p.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fmgm7","text":"There's also a new tab called VIRTUAL DIGEST. Click it. ChangeÂ Ladder option to \"NEB 2-Log\", which is the ladder we are using in the lab. title: Diagnostic Restriction Digest
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"1ieb6","text":"None of the materials we're using today are hazardous.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2rmpn","text":"HOWEVER, we are shedding nucleases -- enzymes that degrade DNA -- all the time. Wear lab coats and gloves to keep your samples nuclease-free.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
